title: Launcher file deleting after I reboot my computer overnight
body: I tried to play a game with some friends and could not load the game after we went through champion select. I noticed my launcher file was not in RADS -> Projects and tried to use the repair tool which did nothing then did a reinstall. The reinstall put the launcher folder back into its place and then I played a game or two for the night then shut down my computer. I turned my computer back on to play again today and could not load the game up after champion select and noticed the folder was once again gone. I am redownloading and going to test if it happens to be my antivirus (AVG) or if it won't continue to happen but I wonder if this is a common/known problem since I know many client/pre-game issues happen daily.

replies.body:
I'm not 100% sure which you're talking about in the RADS-> Projects folder, but you should be able to launch the game normally by simply using the desktop shortcut or this file in the normal League of Legends Folder. What file were you looking for??

https://i.gyazo.com/6c09810be5e7fb448a27961d2f3a8e0a.png

There is 2 file folders in the path that I said that every time I restart my computer get deleted for some reason. Everyone who I play with have these folders and they have been there on clean installs and work but when they are gone I can't load into a game after champion select. I can get into the client but not into an actual game once champion select is over.
